question:
You recently bought a piece of equipment for your kitchen but it did not work. You phoned the shop but no action was taken. Write a letter to shop manager. In your letter:
- Describe the problem with the equipment
- explain what happened when Phoned the shop
- say what would you like the manager to do
text: I am writing this letter to draw your attention about defaulted Microwave oven that was delivered at my doorstep.

On Monday 04-May-2020, I visited your store located in Sambaji Chowk, Ulhasnagar – 421004. I was pleased with the brands of Microwave ovens at your place. Apparently, I booked Samsung 2 litre Microwave oven model number 32145. However, after delivery when tried to operate with constant temperature while preparation of cookies, our kitchen faced a short circuit. Later, another recipe was tried, which also resulted same and even worse affecting mass short circuit of apartment.

As soon as I noticed some technical issues with the equipment, I called up at your store. Despite being my phone was put on hold, it was disconnected after 15 minutes.Furthermore, customer service agent
picked up after 4 calls, and stated strongly against replacement of valuable item.

I would request you to look into current matter. Although a replacement of Microwave oven will be appreciated, which is need of the day. Adding to it, as said Customer is king, please respect their calls and value them.
